column4: X failed to start on boot all of a sudden. :( I think it's a failed update or so.
how do I do those updates without X running?
oh yeah okay just found it too, thanks
this is really horrible panicking in 3,2...
nope :(
has sanyone had any problems like that here lately?
X not starting.
Can you boot into recovery mode?
sudo apt-get remove fglrx && sudo rm /etc/X11/xorg.conf && sudo reboot
That should get X starting at least
thanks dude
should I do a bug report? I didn't do anything too special to cause it (except updating packages)
Did X start?
it did now
Don't get halfway through a driver install and expect it to work. Also, the default open source radeon driver is fully capable these days
the driver worked previously. I think ubuntu asked me to upgrade the kernel, and that somehow had trouble in the middle.
There's always trouble with proprietary drivers
I see, OK.
If you'd like to use latest radeon drivers, install xorg-edgers repo
well, it's all right now, I'll worry about getting it again later :)
Yea, you're using the open driver now
with how much I upgraded, it'd probably be faster than I'm used to anyway
